intro: Borya septentrionalis, commonly known as the northern borya, is a flowering plant native to the northern regions of North America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils and thrives in shaded to partially sunny conditions. Its botanical features include dark green leaves and pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. Borya septentrionalis is often found in boreal forests and is adapted to cold climates.
